info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 7:40PM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
At 739 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near The Intersection Of Ranch Road 2596 And Ranch Road 864, or 15 miles southwest of Fort Mckavett, moving east at 40 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible.
Locations impacted include... Junction, Menard, Eden, Telegraph, South Llano River State Park, Roosevelt, Fort Mckavett, Live Oak, The Intersection Of Us- 83 And Ranch Road 1773, The Intersection Of Us- 87 And Ranch Road 2134, Adams, The Intersection Of Ranch Road 2596 And Ranch Road 864, Camp Sol Mayer, Us-83 Near The Menard- Concho County Line, Cleo, Us-83 Near The Kimble- Menard County Line, I-10 Near The Sutton- Kimble County Line, The Intersection Of Us- 190 And Ranch Road 2084, The Intersection Of Us- 83 And Highway 29, and Us-377 Near The Kimble-Edwards County Line.
People attending Junction Eagle Stadium, Eden Sanders Field, and Menard Findlay Field should seek safe shelter immediately!
This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 407 and 460.
info.instruction:
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in San Angelo.
A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for west central Texas. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until midnight CDT for west central Texas.

parameter.value: A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EASTERN SCHLEICHER...WESTERN KIMBLE...SOUTHEASTERN TOM GREEN...MENARD...SOUTHERN CONCHO AND EASTERN SUTTON COUNTIES THROUGH 845 PM CDT

area.areaDesc: Tom Green; Concho; Schleicher; Sutton; Menard; Kimble
